FieldMessageType.description: Describes the type of message for validator topic fields. This aligns with InfoItemType but is simplified for form field definitions.
FieldMessageType.markdownDescription:
Describes the type of message for validator topic fields.
This aligns with InfoItemType but is simplified for form field definitions.

FieldValueHumanify.description: Describes the way field values should be converted to a more human-readable format.
FieldValueHumanify.markdownDescription: Describes the way field values should be converted to a more human-readable format.

ICondition.description:
Represents a condition that can be evaluated against data.

Conditions are used to determine visibility of fields, validity of data, and for summarizer token switching logic.
ICondition.markdownDescription:
Represents a condition that can be evaluated against data.

Conditions are used to determine visibility of fields, validity of data,
and for summarizer token switching logic.

anyValues.description: Alternative: match if the field value equals ANY of these values. Useful for enum-like checks.
anyValues.markdownDescription:
Alternative: match if the field value equals ANY of these values.
Useful for enum-like checks.

field.description: The field path to check. Supports dot notation for nested fields.
field.markdownDescription: The field path to check. Supports dot notation for nested fields.

value.description: The value to compare against. Supports numbers, strings, and booleans.
value.markdownDescription:
The value to compare against.
Supports numbers, strings, and booleans.

IConjunctionToken.description: Conjunction token: joins child token arrays with a conjunction.
IConjunctionToken.markdownDescription: Conjunction token: joins child token arrays with a conjunction.

effects.description:
Visual effects for enhanced rendering.

Effects are optional and purely for display enhancement. The summarizer always produces valid plain text regardless of effects.
effects.markdownDescription:
Visual effects for enhanced rendering.

Effects are optional and purely for display enhancement.
The summarizer always produces valid plain text regardless of effects.

items.description: Items to join with the conjunction.
items.markdownDescription: Items to join with the conjunction.

priority.description:
Priority for truncation when space is limited. Lower numbers are more important and will be kept.
- Priority 1: Essential information, always show
- Priority 2: Important details
- Priority 3: Nice-to-have comparisons
- Priority 4+: Optional flavor text
priority.markdownDescription:
Priority for truncation when space is limited.
Lower numbers are more important and will be kept.
- Priority 1: Essential information, always show
- Priority 2: Important details
- Priority 3: Nice-to-have comparisons
- Priority 4+: Optional flavor text

type.description: The type of token. Determines how the token is evaluated.
type.markdownDescription: The type of token. Determines how the token is evaluated.

visibility.description: Optional conditions that must ALL be true for this token to appear. Uses the same ICondition format as field visibility in forms.
visibility.markdownDescription:
Optional conditions that must ALL be true for this token to appear.
Uses the same ICondition format as field visibility in forms.

IExistsToken.description:
Exists token: outputs tokens only if a field is defined (or undefined).

Useful for optional fields where presence/absence is meaningful.
IExistsToken.markdownDescription:
Exists token: outputs tokens only if a field is defined (or undefined).

Useful for optional fields where presence/absence is meaningful.

effects.description:
Visual effects for enhanced rendering.

Effects are optional and purely for display enhancement. The summarizer always produces valid plain text regardless of effects.
effects.markdownDescription:
Visual effects for enhanced rendering.

Effects are optional and purely for display enhancement.
The summarizer always produces valid plain text regardless of effects.

priority.description:
Priority for truncation when space is limited. Lower numbers are more important and will be kept.
- Priority 1: Essential information, always show
- Priority 2: Important details
- Priority 3: Nice-to-have comparisons
- Priority 4+: Optional flavor text
priority.markdownDescription:
Priority for truncation when space is limited.
Lower numbers are more important and will be kept.
- Priority 1: Essential information, always show
- Priority 2: Important details
- Priority 3: Nice-to-have comparisons
- Priority 4+: Optional flavor text

treatEmptyAsUndefined.description: If true, also treat empty strings, empty arrays, and empty objects as "undefined".
treatEmptyAsUndefined.markdownDescription: If true, also treat empty strings, empty arrays, and empty objects as "undefined".

type.description: The type of token. Determines how the token is evaluated.
type.markdownDescription: The type of token. Determines how the token is evaluated.

visibility.description: Optional conditions that must ALL be true for this token to appear. Uses the same ICondition format as field visibility in forms.
visibility.markdownDescription:
Optional conditions that must ALL be true for this token to appear.
Uses the same ICondition format as field visibility in forms.

whenDefined.description: Tokens to output when the field IS defined.
whenDefined.markdownDescription: Tokens to output when the field IS defined.

whenUndefined.description: Tokens to output when the field is NOT defined. If not provided, outputs nothing when undefined.
whenUndefined.markdownDescription:
Tokens to output when the field is NOT defined.
If not provided, outputs nothing when undefined.

additionalIndent.description: Specifies whether visual presentations of this data should have any additional indents
additionalIndent.markdownDescription: Specifies whether visual presentations of this data should have any additional indents

additionalPropertiesOf.description: Specifies the data type for additional properties in a keyed collection. When set, this generates additionalProperties schema based on the specified FieldDataType. For example, additionalPropertiesOf: FieldDataType.molangArray would generate additionalProperties with the Molang array schema.
additionalPropertiesOf.markdownDescription:
Specifies the data type for additional properties in a keyed collection.
When set, this generates additionalProperties schema based on the specified FieldDataType.
For example, additionalPropertiesOf: FieldDataType.molangArray would generate
additionalProperties with the Molang array schema.

allowCreateDelete.description: If this field is an array or keyed set, whether new items can be created or existing items can be deleted.
allowCreateDelete.markdownDescription: If this field is an array or keyed set, whether new items can be created or existing items can be deleted.

altId.description: Optional alternate identifier for the field.
altId.markdownDescription: Optional alternate identifier for the field.

alternates.description: Specifies a list of alternate representation for data for this field. For example, a field that is a string can have an alternate representation as a number, and would have an alternate field for it.
alternates.markdownDescription: Specifies a list of alternate representation for data for this field. For example, a field that is a string can have an alternate representation as a number, and would have an alternate field for it.

choices.description: Specifies a fixed list of choices for this field.
choices.markdownDescription: Specifies a fixed list of choices for this field.

dataType.description: Specifies the data type of the field, which determines how the data is interpreted and validated.
dataType.markdownDescription: Specifies the data type of the field, which determines how the data is interpreted and validated.

defaultValue.description: Specifies what the default value of this field should be if it's not specified in the data.
defaultValue.markdownDescription: Specifies what the default value of this field should be if it's not specified in the data.

description.description: Optional human-readable description for the field. If the description is functionally equivalent to its title, the description can be omitted.
description.markdownDescription:
Optional human-readable description for the field.
If the description is functionally equivalent to its title, the description can be omitted.

displayTitle.description: When displaying the field in a user interface, whether to display the title for the field.
displayTitle.markdownDescription: When displaying the field in a user interface, whether to display the title for the field.

experienceType.description: Specifies a particular visual experiene for the field.
experienceType.markdownDescription: Specifies a particular visual experiene for the field.

fixedLength.description: For array types, this specifies that the sub-field should be an array of objects of a fixed length.
fixedLength.markdownDescription: For array types, this specifies that the sub-field should be an array of objects of a fixed length.

forceString.description: Whether to force the field to be treated as a string, even if it appears to be another type.
forceString.markdownDescription: Whether to force the field to be treated as a string, even if it appears to be another type.

hideSamples.description: Specifies whether the samples for this field should be hidden in the target source (UI or documentation). This is typically used for fields whether the samples are not interesting. Eg., "priority": 2 as an sample of a priority field.
hideSamples.markdownDescription:
Specifies whether the samples for this field should be hidden in the target source (UI or documentation).
This is typically used for fields whether the samples are not interesting. Eg., "priority": 2 as an sample of a priority field.

howToUse.description: Optional human-readable guidance on how to use or fix issues related to this field. For validation rules, this contains tips for how to resolve validation errors or warnings.
howToUse.markdownDescription:
Optional human-readable guidance on how to use or fix issues related to this field.
For validation rules, this contains tips for how to resolve validation errors or warnings.

humanifyValues.description: Specifies whether values of this field should be transformed via an algorithm to be more human-readable and "friendly".
humanifyValues.markdownDescription: Specifies whether values of this field should be transformed via an algorithm to be more human-readable and "friendly".

isDeprecated.description: Specifies whether this field is deprecated and should not be used in new code.
isDeprecated.markdownDescription: Specifies whether this field is deprecated and should not be used in new code.

isInternal.description: Specifies whether this field is internal and not intended for public use.
isInternal.markdownDescription: Specifies whether this field is internal and not intended for public use.

isRemoved.description: A placeholder for internal content build processes to signify that this field should NOT be merged in via automatic processes and should not really exist in the final schema.
isRemoved.markdownDescription:
A placeholder for internal content build processes to signify that this field should NOT be merged in via automatic processes and should not really exist
in the final schema.

isRequired.description: Specifies whether this field is required to have a value.
isRequired.markdownDescription: Specifies whether this field is required to have a value.

keyDescription.description: Description of the field that is used for human-readable purposes. This is typically used to provide a more user-friendly description of the key of this field.
keyDescription.markdownDescription:
Description of the field that is used for human-readable purposes.
This is typically used to provide a more user-friendly description of the key of this field.

lookupId.description: Context-specfic identifier for data set to use for lookups for the field.
lookupId.markdownDescription: Context-specfic identifier for data set to use for lookups for the field.

matchObjectArrayLengthToSubFieldLength.description: If this field references an array of objects, this is the key that maps the array length to its sub field length.
matchObjectArrayLengthToSubFieldLength.markdownDescription: If this field references an array of objects, this is the key that maps the array length to its sub field length.

matchObjectArrayToSubFieldKey.description: If this field references an array of objects, this specifies that objects in the array should map to its corresponding sub-field.
matchObjectArrayToSubFieldKey.markdownDescription: If this field references an array of objects, this specifies that objects in the array should map to its corresponding sub-field.

matchedValues.description: Specifies matched values that reference project updaters. Used in mctoolsval forms to associate topic IDs with their corresponding updaters.
matchedValues.markdownDescription:
Specifies matched values that reference project updaters. Used in mctoolsval forms
to associate topic IDs with their corresponding updaters.

maxLength.description: If the field is a string related, the maximum length of the string.
maxLength.markdownDescription: If the field is a string related, the maximum length of the string.

maxValue.description: If the field is a number, float, or integer, this specifies the maximum value that the field can take.
maxValue.markdownDescription: If the field is a number, float, or integer, this specifies the maximum value that the field can take.

mergeSubForm.description: Used in override files to request merging of generated subForm content into the override's subForm. When set to true, the generated subForm fields will be merged into the override's existing subForm. Use this when you want to keep your override's subForm fields AND add generated fields. Contrast with having just subForm without mergeSubForm, which replaces the generated subForm entirely.
mergeSubForm.markdownDescription:
Used in override files to request merging of generated subForm content into the override's subForm.
When set to true, the generated subForm fields will be merged into the override's existing subForm.
Use this when you want to keep your override's subForm fields AND add generated fields.
Contrast with having just subForm without mergeSubForm, which replaces the generated subForm entirely.

messageType.description: For validator topic fields, specifies the type of message (info, warning, error, recommendation). This helps categorize the severity or nature of validation results.
messageType.markdownDescription:
For validator topic fields, specifies the type of message (info, warning, error, recommendation).
This helps categorize the severity or nature of validation results.

minLength.description: If the field is a string related, the minimum length of the string.
minLength.markdownDescription: If the field is a string related, the minimum length of the string.

minValue.description: If the field is a number, float, or integer, this specifies the minimum value that the field can take.
minValue.markdownDescription: If the field is a number, float, or integer, this specifies the minimum value that the field can take.

mustMatchChoices.description: Specifies whether the data for this field must match the set of defined choices or lookup values.
mustMatchChoices.markdownDescription: Specifies whether the data for this field must match the set of defined choices or lookup values.

newItemPrototype.description: Prototype example of the data structure for new items that are created
newItemPrototype.markdownDescription: Prototype example of the data structure for new items that are created

note.description: Any additional English descriptions about notes for this data of this field definition. .note vs. .note2 vs. .note3 are expected to be different "topics" for notes.
note.markdownDescription:
Any additional English descriptions about notes for this data of this field definition.
.note vs. .note2 vs. .note3 are expected to be different "topics" for notes.

note2.description: Any additional English descriptions about notes for this data of this field definition. .note vs. .note2 vs. .note3 are expected to be different "topics" for notes.
note2.markdownDescription:
Any additional English descriptions about notes for this data of this field definition.
.note vs. .note2 vs. .note3 are expected to be different "topics" for notes.

note3.description: Any additional English descriptions about notes for this data of this field definition. .note vs. .note2 vs. .note3 are expected to be different "topics" for notes.
note3.markdownDescription:
Any additional English descriptions about notes for this data of this field definition.
.note vs. .note2 vs. .note3 are expected to be different "topics" for notes.

noun.description: Human-readable name for the field, which is used in the UI to display the field.
noun.markdownDescription: Human-readable name for the field, which is used in the UI to display the field.

objectArrayTitleFieldKey.description: If this field references an array of objects, this is the key that maps the array to its corresponding title field.
objectArrayTitleFieldKey.markdownDescription: If this field references an array of objects, this is the key that maps the array to its corresponding title field.

objectArrayToSubFieldKey.description: If this field references an array of objects, this is the key that maps the array to its corresponding sub-field.
objectArrayToSubFieldKey.markdownDescription: If this field references an array of objects, this is the key that maps the array to its corresponding sub-field.

priority.description: When sorting this field amongst other fields, this is the priority of the field. Lower numbers are sorted first, and higher numbers are sorted last. If two numbers are tied, then fields are alphabetically sorted by their id.
priority.markdownDescription:
When sorting this field amongst other fields, this is the priority of the field.
Lower numbers are sorted first, and higher numbers are sorted last.
If two numbers are tied, then fields are alphabetically sorted by their id.

readOnly.description: Whether to display this field as read only.
readOnly.markdownDescription: Whether to display this field as read only.

retainIfEmptyOrDefault.description: Whether this field should be defined if it's functionally empty (e.g., an empty string or a 0 item array).
retainIfEmptyOrDefault.markdownDescription: Whether this field should be defined if it's functionally empty (e.g., an empty string or a 0 item array).

samples.description: Specifies a set of specific samples of data values for this field.
samples.markdownDescription: Specifies a set of specific samples of data values for this field.

step.description: If the field is a range, this describes the standard step between numbers in the range. This is typically used for sliders or other input methods that allow users to select a value within a range. For example, a step of 5 between 0 and 100 would allow values like 0, 5, 10, ..., 100.
step.markdownDescription:
If the field is a range, this describes the standard step between numbers in the range.
This is typically used for sliders or other input methods that allow users to select a value within a range.
For example, a step of 5 between 0 and 100 would allow values like 0, 5, 10, ..., 100.

subFields.description: Describes an override set of subFields for the sub form. This should only be supplied in rare cases.
subFields.markdownDescription: Describes an override set of subFields for the sub form. This should only be supplied in rare cases.

subForm.description: If this field references an object (e.g., has a dataType of 16 - object or 15 - object Array), this describes the structure of that object.
subForm.markdownDescription: If this field references an object (e.g., has a dataType of 16 - object or 15 - object Array), this describes the structure of that object.

suggestedMaxValue.description: If the field is a number, float, or integer, this specifies a soft, recommended maximum value that the field can take.
suggestedMaxValue.markdownDescription: If the field is a number, float, or integer, this specifies a soft, recommended maximum value that the field can take.

suggestedMinValue.description: If the field is a number, float, or integer, this specifies a soft, recommended minimum value that the field can take.
suggestedMinValue.markdownDescription: If the field is a number, float, or integer, this specifies a soft, recommended minimum value that the field can take.

tags.description: A set of context dependent tag strings that can be used to filter or categorize the field.
tags.markdownDescription: A set of context dependent tag strings that can be used to filter or categorize the field.

technicalDescription.description: Optional human-readable description of technical details of the field - for example, any notes on how the field is persisted in JSON, or other technical details. In practice, this is not shown in tools but is shown in technical documentation.
technicalDescription.markdownDescription:
Optional human-readable description of technical details of the field - for example, any notes
on how the field is persisted in JSON, or other technical details.
In practice, this is not shown in tools but is shown in technical documentation.

title.description: Optional human-readable title for the field. If the title is functionally equivalent to its Id, the title can be omitted.
title.markdownDescription:
Optional human-readable title for the field.
If the title is functionally equivalent to its Id, the title can be omitted.

versionDeprecated.description: Optional version that this field was deprecated and no longer supported, maintained, or recommended in the respective object's data structure.
versionDeprecated.markdownDescription: Optional version that this field was deprecated and no longer supported, maintained, or recommended in the respective object's data structure.

versionIntroduced.description: Optional version that this field was introduced in the respective object's data structure.
versionIntroduced.markdownDescription: Optional version that this field was introduced in the respective object's data structure.

visualExperience.description: Specifies the visual experience for the field.
visualExperience.markdownDescription: Specifies the visual experience for the field.

IFormDefinition.description: IFormDefinition represents a structured definition of a form that describes a data structure. It includes metadata, fields, dependencies, and other relevant information about the form. This interface is used to define the schema and structure of forms in the dataform system. For example, JSON documents can be represented at the top level as an IFormDefinition.
IFormDefinition.markdownDescription:
IFormDefinition represents a structured definition of a form that describes a data structure.
It includes metadata, fields, dependencies, and other relevant information about the form.
This interface is used to define the schema and structure of forms in the dataform system.
For example, JSON documents can be represented at the top level as an IFormDefinition.

customField.description: If this object has an open schema and supports arbitrary fields, this field can be used to define the format of those arbitrary fields.
customField.markdownDescription: If this object has an open schema and supports arbitrary fields, this field can be used to define the format of those arbitrary fields.

dataVersion.description: Optional version of the form definition. This corresponds to the version of the data structure being described, if available.
dataVersion.markdownDescription:
Optional version of the form definition.
This corresponds to the version of the data structure being described, if available.

description.description: Optional human-readable description of the form definition. This should provide context and details about the form's purpose and usage.
description.markdownDescription:
Optional human-readable description of the form definition.
This should provide context and details about the form's purpose and usage.

fields.description: Optional list of fields that are part of the form definition. Each field should conform to the IField interface. This is the fundamental structure of the form definition, detailing the data it can contain.
fields.markdownDescription:
Optional list of fields that are part of the form definition.
Each field should conform to the IField interface.
This is the fundamental structure of the form definition, detailing the data it can contain.

generatedFromSchema_doNotEdit.description: A base definition of the data in this form that can be used as foundation for any annotations or modifications. The generated_doNotEdit and generatedFromSchema_doNotEdit properties are filled out using external build tools, so they should not be modified directly. Rather, if you want to modify, say, a field and its title and description, you should copy that field instance from generated_doNotEdit.fields or generatedFromSchema_doNotEdit.fields into the root .fields property. Any property of the  generated_doNotEdit?: IFormDefinition can be overridden in this way, by duplicating and modifying it into the root IFormDefinition.
generatedFromSchema_doNotEdit.markdownDescription:
A base definition of the data in this form that can be used as foundation for any annotations or modifications.
The generated_doNotEdit and generatedFromSchema_doNotEdit properties are filled out using external build tools,
so they should not be modified directly. Rather, if you want to modify, say, a field and its title and description,
you should copy that field instance from generated_doNotEdit.fields or generatedFromSchema_doNotEdit.fields into
the root .fields property. Any property of the  generated_doNotEdit?: IFormDefinition can be overridden in this
way, by duplicating and modifying it into the root IFormDefinition.

generated_doNotEdit.description: A base definition of the data in this form that can be used as foundation for any annotations or modifications. The generated_doNotEdit and generatedFromSchema_doNotEdit properties are filled out using external build tools, so they should not be modified directly. Rather, if you want to modify, say, a field and its title and description, you should copy that field instance from generated_doNotEdit.fields or generatedFromSchema_doNotEdit.fields into the root .fields property. Any property of the  generated_doNotEdit?: IFormDefinition can be overridden in this way, by duplicating and modifying it into the root IFormDefinition.
generated_doNotEdit.markdownDescription:
A base definition of the data in this form that can be used as foundation for any annotations or modifications.
The generated_doNotEdit and generatedFromSchema_doNotEdit properties are filled out using external build tools,
so they should not be modified directly. Rather, if you want to modify, say, a field and its title and description,
you should copy that field instance from generated_doNotEdit.fields or generatedFromSchema_doNotEdit.fields into
the root .fields property. Any property of the  generated_doNotEdit?: IFormDefinition can be overridden in this
way, by duplicating and modifying it into the root IFormDefinition.

id.description: Unique identifier for the form definition. Typically, this will correspond to the identifier of the data structure being described.
id.markdownDescription: Unique identifier for the form definition. Typically, this will correspond to the identifier of the data structure being described.

isDeprecated.description: Optional boolean indicating if the form definition is deprecated and no longer recommended for use.
isDeprecated.markdownDescription: Optional boolean indicating if the form definition is deprecated and no longer recommended for use.

isExperimental.description: Optional boolean indicating if the form definition is experimental and may change or may be removed in future versions.
isExperimental.markdownDescription: Optional boolean indicating if the form definition is experimental and may change or may be removed in future versions.

isInternal.description: Optional boolean indicating if the form definition is internal and not intended for public use.
isInternal.markdownDescription: Optional boolean indicating if the form definition is internal and not intended for public use.

note.description: Any additional English descriptions about notes for this data of this form definition. .note vs. .note2 vs. .note3 are expected to be different "topics" for notes.
note.markdownDescription:
Any additional English descriptions about notes for this data of this form definition.
.note vs. .note2 vs. .note3 are expected to be different "topics" for notes.

note2.description: Any additional English descriptions about notes for this data of this form definition. .note vs. .note2 vs. .note3 are expected to be different "topics" for notes.
note2.markdownDescription:
Any additional English descriptions about notes for this data of this form definition.
.note vs. .note2 vs. .note3 are expected to be different "topics" for notes.

note3.description: Any additional English descriptions about notes for this data of this form definition. .note vs. .note2 vs. .note3 are expected to be different "topics" for notes.
note3.markdownDescription:
Any additional English descriptions about notes for this data of this form definition.
.note vs. .note2 vs. .note3 are expected to be different "topics" for notes.

requiredExperiment.description: Optional string indicating the name of the experiment that this form definition is associated with.
requiredExperiment.markdownDescription: Optional string indicating the name of the experiment that this form definition is associated with.

requires.description: Optional list of dependencies that this form definition requires. The concept of "requires" is context-specific and can vary based on the form's purpose.
requires.markdownDescription:
Optional list of dependencies that this form definition requires.
The concept of "requires" is context-specific and can vary based on the form's purpose.

restrictions.description: Optional list of dependencies that this form definition requires. The concept of "restrictions" is context-specific and can vary based on the form's purpose.
restrictions.markdownDescription:
Optional list of dependencies that this form definition requires.
The concept of "restrictions" is context-specific and can vary based on the form's purpose.

samples.description: An optional set of samples that can be used to illustrate the form definition.
samples.markdownDescription: An optional set of samples that can be used to illustrate the form definition.

scalarField.description: In some schemas, this object may be represented with a simpler scalar value, like a number or a string. This field provides a definition for what the simpler "scalar" representation should be.
scalarField.markdownDescription:
In some schemas, this object may be represented with a simpler scalar value, like a number or a string. This field
provides a definition for what the simpler "scalar" representation should be.

scalarFieldUpgradeName.description: In some schemas, this object may be represented with a simpler scalar value, like a number or a string. This field identifies a subfield that provides schema representation of that scalar value. For example, in some schemas you can represent a object reference as either {  "model": "geometry:skeleton" } OR {  "model": { "id": "geometry:skeleton", "priority" : 3 } } In this example a form representing the structure of the { id, priority } model reference object, the scalarFieldUpgradeName would be "id" since that field is the scalar representation of the object.

strictAdditionalProperties.description: Controls whether the validator should flag unexpected properties that are not defined in the form's fields. If true, the validator will report any properties that are not in the schema as validation errors. If false or undefined, unexpected properties will be allowed (default behavior for Minecraft content).
strictAdditionalProperties.markdownDescription:
Controls whether the validator should flag unexpected properties that are not defined in the form's fields.
If true, the validator will report any properties that are not in the schema as validation errors.
If false or undefined, unexpected properties will be allowed (default behavior for Minecraft content).

summarizer.description:
Optional summarizer definition for generating natural language descriptions. When present, a summary card will be displayed at the top of the form showing a human-readable description of the current data values.

Summarizers can be:
- Inline: Full ISummarizer object embedded in the form
- External: Loaded from a .summarizer.json file alongside the form
summarizer.markdownDescription:
Optional summarizer definition for generating natural language descriptions.
When present, a summary card will be displayed at the top of the form showing
a human-readable description of the current data values.

Summarizers can be:
- Inline: Full ISummarizer object embedded in the form
- External: Loaded from a .summarizer.json file alongside the form

summarizerId.description: ID of an external summarizer definition file. If provided, the summarizer will be loaded from this path. Format: \"category/name\" - always relative to the forms folder. Does NOT include the .summarizer.json suffix.
summarizerId.markdownDescription:
ID of an external summarizer definition file.
If provided, the summarizer will be loaded from this path.
Format: \"category/name\" - always relative to the forms folder.
Does NOT include the .summarizer.json suffix.

tags.description: A set of topical annotations for this form definition.
tags.markdownDescription: A set of topical annotations for this form definition.

technicalDescription.description: Optional human-readable description of technical details of the form definition. In practice, this is not shown in tools but is shown in technical documentation. This should provide context and details about the form's purpose and usage.
technicalDescription.markdownDescription:
Optional human-readable description of technical details of the form definition.
In practice, this is not shown in tools but is shown in technical documentation.
This should provide context and details about the form's purpose and usage.

title.description: Optional human-readable name for the form definition.
title.markdownDescription: Optional human-readable name for the form definition.

versionDeprecated.description: For the data object being described, the version that this schema was no longer maintained or supported.
versionDeprecated.markdownDescription: For the data object being described, the version that this schema was no longer maintained or supported.

versionIntroduced.description: For the data object being described, the version that this schema was introduced in.
versionIntroduced.markdownDescription: For the data object being described, the version that this schema was introduced in.

description.description: Optional human-readable description of the dependency. This can help clarify the purpose and usage of the dependency.
description.markdownDescription:
Optional human-readable description of the dependency.
This can help clarify the purpose and usage of the dependency.

id.description: Unique identifier for the dependency. This should correspond to the identifier of the data structure or form that this dependency relates to.
id.markdownDescription:
Unique identifier for the dependency.
This should correspond to the identifier of the data structure or form that this dependency relates to.

type.description: A context-specific description of the type of dependency.
type.markdownDescription: A context-specific description of the type of dependency.

content.description: Content of the sample, which can be a JSON object, string, number, or boolean.
content.markdownDescription: Content of the sample, which can be a JSON object, string, number, or boolean.

path.description: Path where the sample is exhibited, or simple description of the sample.
path.markdownDescription: Path where the sample is exhibited, or simple description of the sample.

IGroupToken.description: Group token: groups tokens together, useful for shared visibility.
IGroupToken.markdownDescription: Group token: groups tokens together, useful for shared visibility.

effects.description:
Visual effects for enhanced rendering.

Effects are optional and purely for display enhancement. The summarizer always produces valid plain text regardless of effects.

priority.description:
Priority for truncation when space is limited. Lower numbers are more important and will be kept.
- Priority 1: Essential information, always show
- Priority 2: Important details
- Priority 3: Nice-to-have comparisons
- Priority 4+: Optional flavor text

visibility.description: Optional conditions that must ALL be true for this token to appear. Uses the same ICondition format as field visibility in forms.

IListItem.description: A single item in a list token.
IListItem.markdownDescription: A single item in a list token.

tokens.description: Tokens that make up this list item.
tokens.markdownDescription: Tokens that make up this list item.

visibility.description: Conditions for this item to be included in the list.
visibility.markdownDescription: Conditions for this item to be included in the list.

IListToken.description:
List token: renders items as a grammatically correct list.

Automatically handles:
- Empty list: outputs emptyText or nothing
- Single item: just the item
- Two items: "A and B"
- Three+ items: "A, B, and C"

Only items whose tokens produce non-empty output are included.
IListToken.markdownDescription:
List token: renders items as a grammatically correct list.

Automatically handles:
- Empty list: outputs emptyText or nothing
- Single item: just the item
- Two items: "A and B"
- Three+ items: "A, B, and C"

Only items whose tokens produce non-empty output are included.

emptyText.description: Text to output when no items are visible. If not provided, the entire list token outputs nothing.
emptyText.markdownDescription:
Text to output when no items are visible.

finalSeparator.description: Separator before the last item when there are 3+ items.
finalSeparator.markdownDescription: Separator before the last item when there are 3+ items.

items.description: Each item is an object with optional visibility and required tokens.
items.markdownDescription: Each item is an object with optional visibility and required tokens.

prefix.description: Tokens to output before the list (only if list is non-empty).
prefix.markdownDescription: Tokens to output before the list (only if list is non-empty).

suffix.description: Tokens to output after the list (only if list is non-empty).

ISampleToken.description:
Sample token: pulls a sample value from form.json to use as a reference.

This encourages AI to create rich comparisons using real examples from the data. The form.json can contain samples like: ```json {   "samples": {     "entities/warden": { "max": 500, "value": 500 },     "entities/zombie": { "max": 20, "value": 20 }   } } ```

effects.description:
Visual effects for enhanced rendering.

Effects are optional and purely for display enhancement. The summarizer always produces valid plain text regardless of effects.

Visual effects for enhanced rendering.

Effects are optional and purely for display enhancement.
The summarizer always produces valid plain text regardless of effects.

field.markdownDescription: Field within the sample to extract.

ISummarizer.description:
The main summarizer definition.

A summarizer contains phrases that are evaluated against data to produce natural language descriptions.

## Complete Example

```json {   "id": "minecraft_projectile",   "intent": "Describe projectile behavior and combat characteristics",   "description": "Summarizes how a projectile entity behaves when fired",

  "phrases": [     {       "id": "damage",       "description": "How much damage the projectile deals",       "priority": 1,       "visibility": [{ "field": "power", "comparison": "defined" }],       "tokens": [         { "type": "literal", "text": "deals " },         {           "type": "switch",           "cases": [             {               "conditions": [{ "field": "power", "comparison": ">", "value": 10 }],               "tokens": [{ "type": "literal", "text": "devastating damage" }]             },             {               "conditions": [{ "field": "power", "comparison": ">", "value": 5 }],               "tokens": [{ "type": "literal", "text": "significant damage" }]             }           ],           "default": [{ "type": "literal", "text": "light damage" }]         },         { "type": "literal", "text": " on impact" }       ]     },     {       "id": "special_effects",       "description": "Special effects when hitting a target",       "priority": 2,       "tokens": [         {           "type": "list",           "items": [             {               "visibility": [{ "field": "catch_fire", "comparison": "=", "value": true }],               "tokens": [{ "type": "literal", "text": "sets targets on fire" }]             },             {               "visibility": [{ "field": "lightning", "comparison": "=", "value": true }],               "tokens": [{ "type": "literal", "text": "summons lightning" }]             },             {               "visibility": [{ "field": "knockback", "comparison": "=", "value": true }],               "tokens": [{ "type": "literal", "text": "knocks back targets" }]             }           ],           "emptyText": ""         }       ]     }   ],

  "references": {     "arrow_damage": { "value": 2, "label": "a standard Arrow" },     "trident_damage": { "value": 9, "label": "a Trident" }   },

  "examples": [     {       "description": "Powerful fire projectile",       "input": { "power": 15, "catch_fire": true, "lightning": false, "knockback": true },       "output": ["deals devastating damage on impact", "sets targets on fire and knocks back targets"]     }   ] } ```

description.description: Detailed description of the summarizer's purpose and approach.
description.markdownDescription: Detailed description of the summarizer's purpose and approach.

examples.description:
Example input/output pairs for AI learning and validation. AI should study these to understand the expected style and detail level.

## Style Guide for Examples

- Cover edge cases (very high, very low, typical values)
- Show how comparisons should read
- Demonstrate proper grammar for lists
- Include examples with multiple phrases
examples.markdownDescription:
Example input/output pairs for AI learning and validation.
AI should study these to understand the expected style and detail level.

## Style Guide for Examples

- Cover edge cases (very high, very low, typical values)
- Show how comparisons should read
- Demonstrate proper grammar for lists
- Include examples with multiple phrases

id.description: Unique identifier for this summarizer. Should match the form ID it describes (e.g., "minecraft_health").
id.markdownDescription:
Unique identifier for this summarizer.
Should match the form ID it describes (e.g., "minecraft_health").

intent.description: High-level intent of this summarizer. Helps AI understand what aspects of the data to focus on.
intent.markdownDescription:
High-level intent of this summarizer.
Helps AI understand what aspects of the data to focus on.

phrases.description: The phrases that this summarizer can generate. Each phrase is evaluated independently and may or may not produce output based on the data and visibility conditions.
phrases.markdownDescription:
The phrases that this summarizer can generate.
Each phrase is evaluated independently and may or may not produce output
based on the data and visibility conditions.

styleNotes.description: Style notes for AI generating or modifying this summarizer. Can include tone preferences, vocabulary choices, etc.
styleNotes.markdownDescription:
Style notes for AI generating or modifying this summarizer.
Can include tone preferences, vocabulary choices, etc.

ISummarizerEffects.description:
Visual effects that can be applied to tokens for richer display.

Effects are OPTIONAL and purely for enhanced rendering. The summarizer will always produce valid plain text output regardless of effects.

## Design Philosophy

Effects use SEMANTIC values (positive/negative, strong/subtle) rather than literal styling (red, bold) so that:
- They adapt to light/dark themes
- They work with accessibility requirements
- They degrade gracefully to plain text

## When to Use Effects

- **emphasis: "strong"** - For key values you want to stand out
- **emphasis: "subtle"** - For parenthetical context or units
- **sentiment: "positive"** - High health, good stats, buffs
- **sentiment: "negative"** - Low health, weaknesses, debuffs
- **sentiment: "warning"** - Dangerous abilities, caution needed
- **badge: true** - For categories, tags, or short labels
- **icon** - For visual flair (emoji work well)
ISummarizerEffects.markdownDescription:
Visual effects that can be applied to tokens for richer display.

Effects are OPTIONAL and purely for enhanced rendering. The summarizer
will always produce valid plain text output regardless of effects.

## Design Philosophy

Effects use SEMANTIC values (positive/negative, strong/subtle) rather than
literal styling (red, bold) so that:
- They adapt to light/dark themes
- They work with accessibility requirements
- They degrade gracefully to plain text

## When to Use Effects

- **emphasis: "strong"** - For key values you want to stand out
- **emphasis: "subtle"** - For parenthetical context or units
- **sentiment: "positive"** - High health, good stats, buffs
- **sentiment: "negative"** - Low health, weaknesses, debuffs
- **sentiment: "warning"** - Dangerous abilities, caution needed
- **badge: true** - For categories, tags, or short labels
- **icon** - For visual flair (emoji work well)

badge.description: Render as a badge/pill shape. Good for short categories or tags like "ranged", "explosive", "boss".
badge.markdownDescription:
Render as a badge/pill shape.
Good for short categories or tags like "ranged", "explosive", "boss".

icon.description: Optional icon to display before the token text. Can be an emoji (❤️, ⚔️, 🏃) or an icon identifier.
icon.markdownDescription:
Optional icon to display before the token text.
Can be an emoji (❤️, ⚔️, 🏃) or an icon identifier.

iconPosition.description: Position of the icon relative to the text.
iconPosition.markdownDescription: Position of the icon relative to the text.

ISummarizerExample.description: An example input/output pair for AI training and validation.

examples.output: has god-tier health (500 HP, tougher than an Ender Dragon)

ISummarizerExample.markdownDescription: An example input/output pair for AI training and validation.

description.description: Optional description of what this example demonstrates.
description.markdownDescription: Optional description of what this example demonstrates.

output.description: The expected output phrase(s). Can be a single string or array of strings for multiple phrases.
output.markdownDescription:
The expected output phrase(s).
Can be a single string or array of strings for multiple phrases.

ISummarizerPhrase.description:
A single phrase that can be generated by the summarizer.

Phrases are designed to complete "This object ____".
ISummarizerPhrase.markdownDescription:
A single phrase that can be generated by the summarizer.

Phrases are designed to complete "This object ____".

category.description: Category for grouping related phrases. Useful for organizing output or filtering phrases.
category.markdownDescription:
Category for grouping related phrases.
Useful for organizing output or filtering phrases.

description.description: Human-readable description of what this phrase describes. Helps AI understand the purpose when generating or modifying summarizers.
description.markdownDescription:
Human-readable description of what this phrase describes.
Helps AI understand the purpose when generating or modifying summarizers.

id.description: Optional identifier for this phrase, useful for debugging and documentation.
id.markdownDescription: Optional identifier for this phrase, useful for debugging and documentation.

priority.description:
Priority determines the order and importance of phrases. Lower numbers are more important and appear first.

- Priority 1: Core identity (what this thing fundamentally is/does)
- Priority 2: Primary characteristics (main stats, key behaviors)
- Priority 3: Secondary characteristics (less important details)
- Priority 4+: Flavor/additional context

When truncation is needed, higher priority phrases are removed first.
priority.markdownDescription:
Priority determines the order and importance of phrases.
Lower numbers are more important and appear first.

- Priority 1: Core identity (what this thing fundamentally is/does)
- Priority 2: Primary characteristics (main stats, key behaviors)
- Priority 3: Secondary characteristics (less important details)
- Priority 4+: Flavor/additional context

When truncation is needed, higher priority phrases are removed first.

tokens.description: The tokens that make up this phrase. Evaluated in order to produce the phrase text.
tokens.markdownDescription:
The tokens that make up this phrase.
Evaluated in order to produce the phrase text.

visibility.description: Conditions that must ALL be true for this phrase to be generated. If not provided, the phrase is always considered (subject to token visibility).
visibility.markdownDescription:
Conditions that must ALL be true for this phrase to be generated.
If not provided, the phrase is always considered (subject to token visibility).

ISummarizerToken.description: Union type of all summarizer token types.
ISummarizerToken.markdownDescription: Union type of all summarizer token types.

ISwitchCase.description: A single case in a switch token.
ISwitchCase.markdownDescription: A single case in a switch token.

conditions.description: Conditions that must ALL be true for this case to be selected.
conditions.markdownDescription: Conditions that must ALL be true for this case to be selected.

tokens.description: Tokens to output when this case is selected.
tokens.markdownDescription: Tokens to output when this case is selected.

ISwitchToken.description:
Switch token: selects tokens based on conditions.

Cases are evaluated in order, and the first matching case is used. If no case matches, the default tokens are used (if provided).

## Best Practice: Order Cases from Most to Least Specific

tokens.text: extremely high health, tougher than an Ender Dragon
high health, like an Iron Golem
very fragile, weaker than a Chicken

ISwitchToken.markdownDescription:
Switch token: selects tokens based on conditions.

Cases are evaluated in order, and the first matching case is used.
If no case matches, the default tokens are used (if provided).

## Best Practice: Order Cases from Most to Least Specific

cases.description: Ordered list of cases. First matching case wins.
cases.markdownDescription: Ordered list of cases. First matching case wins.

default.description: Tokens to output if no case matches.
default.markdownDescription: Tokens to output if no case matches.

field.description: The field path to get the value from. Supports dot notation for nested fields: "damage.min"
field.markdownDescription:
The field path to get the value from.

format.description:
Optional format for the value.
- "number": Format as locale number (1,000)
- "percent": Multiply by 100 and add % (0.25 → "25%")
- "decimal:N": Round to N decimal places

- "number": Format as locale number (1,000)
- "percent": Multiply by 100 and add % (0.25 → "25%")
- "decimal:N": Round to N decimal places

SummarizerEmphasis.description:
Semantic emphasis level for token display.

Use semantic emphasis rather than literal styling (bold, italic) so that the rendering can adapt to different themes and contexts.
SummarizerEmphasis.markdownDescription:
Semantic emphasis level for token display.

Use semantic emphasis rather than literal styling (bold, italic) so that
the rendering can adapt to different themes and contexts.

SummarizerHumanifyType.description: Algorithms for making values more human-readable.
SummarizerHumanifyType.markdownDescription: Algorithms for making values more human-readable.

SummarizerRole.description:
Semantic role for consistent styling of different token types.

This provides a way to ensure consistent styling for similar content across different summarizers.
SummarizerRole.markdownDescription:
Semantic role for consistent styling of different token types.

This provides a way to ensure consistent styling for similar content
across different summarizers.

SummarizerSentiment.description:
Semantic sentiment for color-coding tokens.

Sentiment indicates the "meaning" of a value, allowing the renderer to apply appropriate colors that work across themes.
SummarizerSentiment.markdownDescription:
Semantic sentiment for color-coding tokens.

Sentiment indicates the "meaning" of a value, allowing the renderer to
apply appropriate colors that work across themes.
